messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "moe_morten" <mortenmoe@m...> wrote:
> I have a problem using JUnit with apache axis. When I run my test I
> get an exception like this:
>
> java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError:
> org.apache.commons.logging.LogConfigurationException:
> org.apache.commons.logg.....
>
> Anybody seen anything like this?
>
> I am using the latest version of JUnit(3.8.1) integrated into
> Intellij, with apache axis 1.1.
>
> Thanks for any help..

It is not much help, but I am seeing the same problem and have written
a short test program to illustrate it. The program works when called
normally, but fails when called as a JUnit test case. I will try to
put together an Ant script to run the test outside of Idea today. Is
there someone in the Junit organization who will look at it? Here are
the details:

Idea 3.0.1 build 688
Java SDK 1.4.2_03
Junit Release 3.8.1
Apache Jakarta Commons Collections 3.0
Apache Jakarta Commons Logging 1.0.3

The problem occurs when the class
org.apache.commons.logging.impl.LogFactoryImpl throws an exception in
the getInstance method when the code excerpted below fails. Note that
the instance held by logClass is an instance of
org.apache.commons.logging.impl.Jdk14Logger. This class does implement
the Log interface, so the test should not fail (and does not fail
outside of JUnit).

if (!Log.class.isAssignableFrom(logClass)) {
throw new LogConfigurationException
("Class " + logClassName + " does not implement Log");
}

The isAssignableFrom method is a native method, so I could not trace
the execution any further. To be clear, the isAssignable method should
return true here. It does return true when run outside of JUnit, it
doesn't when run inside of JUnit. This is a problem caused by JUnit.

The three classes in the test program are appended here.
====
package com.tinyfrog.TestLogger;

import org.apache.commons.logging.Log;
import org.apache.commons.logging.LogFactory;

public class Startup {

public final static Log commonsLog = LogFactory.getLog("Silly");

public static void main (final String Args []) {
commonsLog.info ("Started main");
}
}

====
package com.tinyfrog.TestLogger;

import org.apache.commons.logging.Log;
import org.apache.commons.logging.LogFactory;

public class SillyClass {
public void sillyMethod () {
Log log = LogFactory.getLog (this.getClass().getName());
log.info ("Message from sillyMethod");
}
}
====
package com.tinyfrog.TestLogger;

import junit.framework.TestCase;
import org.apache.commons.logging.Log;
import org.apache.commons.logging.LogFactory;

public class SillyClassTest extends TestCase{

public SillyClassTest (final String name) {
super (name);
}

Log log = null;

public void setUp () {
log = LogFactory.getLog (this.getClass().getName ());
log.info ("Hi from setUp");
}

public void testSillyClass () {
log.info ("Hi from testSillyClass");
}
}
